content.rendered:
“What did you learn in school, today,” Chris asked his two children, Julia and Daniel.

“We learned about blue green algae,” answered Julia, rather excitedly.

“You mean koombiotic relationships,” Chris asked.

“I think it’s symbiotic, dear,” said Charlotte.

“Oh, yes,” said Chris.

“We learned about eccentric circles,” said Daniel.

“I think you mean…” Charlotte paused. “Never mind.

“What do you have planned for this weekend,” Charlotte asked Chris.

“Well, the school has a football game, tonight. Chris continued, “It’s homecoming, and I’m the queen.”

“You men you’re in charge of the band,” asked Charlotte?

“Right,” said Chris. “And someone has to give away the bride.”

“What do you two have planned for the weekend,” asked Charlotte.

“We’re going to the game,” said Julia and Daniel. “We want to see Dad dressed up like the homecoming queen.”

“He is not dressing up as homecoming queen,” said Charlotte.

Just then, Caff entered the living room.

“Did I hear something about a homecoming queen,” asked Caff,

“It’s going to be a late night for Chris,” said Charlotte. “He has to stay up late for the homecoming game, and then he has to grade papers before next Monday.

“It sounds like he’s going to need some caffeine,” said Caff.

“Noooooo……,” said Chris, rather shocked and alarmed at what he had just heard.

“What’s wrong,” asked Charlotte, as Chris sat up in bed, awoken from a deep sleep.

“Oh, it was horrible,” said Chris. Daniel and I were making all sorts of grammatical errors, and I thought I was going to be homecoming queen.”

“It’s okay,” said Charlotte. “It was only a dream.”

“What’s that,” asked Chris?

“Oh,” replied Charlotte, “it’s a cup of coffee. Caff brought it by for the homecoming game tomorrow night. Remember, you’re homecoming queen.”

“Noooooo…..”
